abstract: Obama administration cites growing concerns about human rights violations in China as it pledges to make issue prominent component of summit talks between Pres Obama and Chinese Pres Xi Jinping; point to particular concern about media censorship and reprisals that keep violence and other issues from being reported to Chinese media or citizens.
lead_paragraph: A top State Department official said Thursday that human rights would feature prominently in talks next month between President Xi Jinping of China and President Obama.

headline.main: Obama Is Set to Discuss Rights Issues With China
headline.print_headline: Obama Is Set to Discuss Rights Issues With China

snippet: A top State Department official said Thursday that human rights would feature prominently in talks next month between President Xi Jinping of China and President Obama.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
